qas.question: Between what years did cubism begin?
In the spring of what year did the first organized exhibition by cubist appear?
What was the name of the room that the first exhibition of Cubists took place?
Who mentioned the landscapes made by Picasso in the first Cubist paintings?
In what city did the first exhibition of Cubists take place?
What painting did Picasso paint in 1908?
What painting did Braque paint in 1907?
What was the name of the room that the last exhibition of Cubists took place?
In what city did the last exhibition of Cubists take place?

context: <b5_0>Cubism began<b5_0/> between <a0_0>1907 and 1911<a0_0/>. Pablo Picasso's 1907 painting <b6_0>Les Demoiselles d'Avignon<b6_0/> has often been considered a proto-Cubist work. Georges Braque's 1908 <b7_0>Houses at L’Estaque<b7_0/> (and related works) prompted the critic Louis Vauxcelles to refer to bizarreries cubiques (cubic oddities). <a3_0>Gertrude Stein<a3_0/> referred to landscapes made by Picasso in 1909, such as Reservoir at Horta de Ebro, as the first Cubist paintings. The first organized group exhibition by Cubists took place at the Salon des Indépendants in <a4_0><b9_0>Paris<b9_0/><a4_0/> during the spring of <a1_0>1911<a1_0/> in a room called '<a2_0><b8_0>Salle 41<b8_0/><a2_0/>'; it included works by Jean Metzinger, Albert Gleizes, Fernand Léger, Robert Delaunay and Henri Le Fauconnier, yet no works by Picasso or Braque were exhibited.
